DOC.brief_summary: This observational study is designed to analyse the urinary mRNA expression of Foxp3 and Vimentin, two genes involved in tolerance and early graft dysfunction in 500 renal transplant recipients from 17 renal transplant site in France and to determine the predictive value of these gene expression on the one year graft outcome including graft function, one-year graft histological analysis and incidence of acute rejection.
DOC.brief_title: Analysis of Foxp3 and Vimentin Expression in Renal Transplant Recipient
DOC.detailed_description: This observational study is designed to analyse the urinary mRNA expression of Foxp3 and Vimentin, two genes involved in tolerance and early graft dysfunction in 500 renal transplant recipients from 17 renal transplant site in France and to determine the predictive value of these gene expression on the one year graft outcome including graft function,
DOC.criteria: All renal transplant recipients aged >18 years with informed consent Kidney transplantation in one of the centers participating in the study all patients registered on the waiting list to the Agency of Biomedicine Supported by a conventional procedure Informed consent signed. No pregnancy or lactation in progress. Serology HIV and (HCV negative suppressed by amendment n°2) No contraindication for a biopsy at 1 year post transplant Positive crossmatch, focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS) as primary nephropathy, HIV positive population Absence of registration on the waiting list for transplantation with the Agency of Biomedicine HIVpositive serology Chronic renal failure secondary to focal segmental hyalinosis Crossmatch historical or cross match of the day positive T or B awareness Patient included in a Memorandum of industry (suppressed by amendment n°1) No affiliation to a social security scheme Patients with early failure due to immediate complications (4%) will be included but will not be considered for analysis
